intro: Boechera canadensis, commonly known as the Canadian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic regions. The plant produces small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are basal, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
